name: Hard Dog, Ship, Horse or Goat,? Quiz / Test | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Dog.

	"Brady," a clumber spaniel, won Westminster in 1996. The clumber resembles a cross between a cocker spaniel and a basset hound, and is the heaviest of the spaniels.

Ship.

	The Star of India is moored in San Diego, CA. Built in 1863 on the Isle of Man, she is the world's oldest sailing ship that is still sailing.

Goat.

	Goodwood King Sunny Ade was the first known buckskin Nigerian dwarf goat.

Dog.

	He was a wire-haired fox terrier, the breed that has won Westminster most often. He won Best in Show twice, in both 1907 and 1909.

Ship.

	The Queen Mary is berthed in Long Beach, CA. Built in 1936, this former ocean liner is now a floating hotel.

Horse.

	Incitatus was the favorite horse of the Roman emperor Caligula. Suetonius, a Roman historian, wrote that, "besides a stall of marble, a manger of ivory, purple blankets and a collar of precious stones, [Caligula] even gave this horse a house. . . . It is also said that he intended to make him Consul."

Horse.

	This palomino was the real "Mr. Ed."

Dog.

	"Lacey," another wire-haired fox terrier, took the Westminster prize in 1992.

Goat.

	This black and white buck was an influential sire behind many Nigerian dwarf goats today- bet you didn't know that!

Horse.

	Everyone (well, Americans, at least!) knows of Paul Revere's ride- but how many know the name of the horse he rode? Revere actually didn't own a horse, so he borrowed Brown Beauty from John Larkin.
